definition: to scratch/old variant of 騷|骚[sao1]
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
lit. to scratch the outside of the boot (idiom)/fig. beside the point/ineffectual

sentences.english: He involuntarily raised his hand to scratch his head.
sentences.chinese: 他下意识地举起手来搔他的头顶。

sentences.english: Hardly had she gone a hundred paces when she paused and began to scratch her head again.
sentences.chinese: 她刚走上百来步，又停下来，搔着自己的头。

sentences.english: The child laughed when his dad tickled him.
sentences.chinese: 父亲搔他孩子痒时，孩子便笑了。

sentences.english: The dog had a good scratch.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆搔搔头，想出一个好主意。

sentences.english: She crawled her fingers behind my ear.
sentences.chinese: 她用指头搔搔我的耳朵背后。

sentences.english: She crawled her fingers behind my ear.
sentences.chinese: 她用指头搔搔我的耳朵背后。

sentences.english: That dog scratches himself a lot because he has fleas.
sentences.chinese: 狗经常抓搔自己，因为它有跳蚤。

sentences.english: Burbo scratched his huge head, in evident embarrassment.
sentences.chinese: 布耳玻显然有些为难地搔了搔大脑袋。

sentences.english: Burbo scratched his huge head, in evident embarrassment.
sentences.chinese: 布耳玻显然有些为难地搔了搔大脑袋。

sentences.english: Scratching his head, Tom thought of a good idea.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆搔搔头，想出一个好主意。

sentences.english: He tickled my feet with a feather.
A cock was scratching in the farmyard for food for the hens.
sentences.chinese: 公鸡在农家的庭院里用爪子搔呀刨呀，为母鸡觅食。

sentences.english: A drypoint is made from an image scratched directly into a metal or plastic plate.
sentences.chinese: 一个铜版画是由一个图像搔直接进入金属或塑料盘。

sentences.english: He scratched the stump of his wrist nervously .
sentences.chinese: 他紧张地搔着腕部残肢。

sentences.english: I tickled him with a feather.
sentences.chinese: 他又伸下手去搔一搔脚脖子。

sentences.english: I tickled him with a feather.
sentences.chinese: 他又伸下手去搔一搔脚脖子。

definition: to comfort/to console/to stroke/to caress/an old term for province or provincial governor
to hold sth long and run one's hand along it
to smooth or arrange sth using one's fingers/to stroke
to move to and fro (with hand, foot, stick etc)/to fiddle with/to stir up
to give a hollow laugh/to force a smile/forced laugh/CL:聲|声[sheng1]
variant of 癢|痒[yang3]/to itch/to tickle
